verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass after<WH310> this,<WH3651> that Absalom<WH53> the son<WH1121> of David<WH1732> had a fair<WH3303> sister,<WH269> whose name<WH8034> was Tamar;<WH8559> and Amnon<WH550> the son<WH1121> of David<WH1732> loved<WH157> her.

And Amnon<WH550> was so vexed,<WH3334> that he fell sick<WH2470> for his sister<WH269> Tamar;<WH8559> for she was a virgin;<WH1330> and Amnon<WH550> thought<WH5869> it hard<WH6381> for him to do<WH6213> anything<WH3972> to her.

But Amnon<WH550> had a friend,<WH7453> whose name<WH8034> was Jonadab,<WH3122> the son<WH1121> of Shimeah<WH8093> David's<WH1732> brother:<WH251> and Jonadab<WH3122> was a very<WH3966> subtle<WH2450> man.<WH376>

And he said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4069> are you, being the king's<WH4428> son,<WH1121> lean<WH1800> from day<WH1242> to day?<WH1242> will you not tell<WH5046> me? And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> to him, I love<WH157> Tamar,<WH8559> my brother<WH251> Absalom's<WH53> sister.<WH269>

And Jonadab<WH3122> said<WH559> to him, Lay<WH7901> you down<WH7901> on<WH5921> your bed,<WH4904> and make yourself sick:<WH2470> and when your father<WH1> comes<WH935> to see<WH7200> you, say<WH559> to him, I pray<WH4994> you, let my sister<WH269> Tamar<WH8559> come,<WH935> and give<WH1262> me meat,<WH3899> and dress<WH6213> the meat<WH1279> in my sight,<WH5869> that I may see<WH7200> it, and eat<WH398> it at her hand.<WH3027>

So Amnon<WH550> lay<WH7901> down,<WH7901> and made himself sick:<WH2470> and when the king<WH4428> was come<WH935> to see<WH7200> him, Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> I pray<WH4994> you, let Tamar<WH8559> my sister<WH269> come,<WH935> and make<WH3823> me a couple<WH8147> of cakes<WH3834> in my sight,<WH5869> that I may eat<WH1262> at her hand.<WH3027>
Then David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> home<WH1004> to Tamar,<WH8559> saying,<WH559> Go<WH3212> now<WH4994> to your brother<WH251> Amnon's<WH550> house,<WH1004> and dress<WH6213> him meat.<WH1279>

So Tamar<WH8559> went<WH3212> to her brother<WH251> Amnon's<WH550> house;<WH1004> and he was laid<WH7901> down.<WH7901> And she took<WH3947> flour,<WH1217> and kneaded<WH3888> it, and made<WH3835> cakes<WH3823> in his sight,<WH5869> and did bake<WH1310> the cakes.<WH3834>

And she took<WH3947> a pan,<WH4958> and poured<WH3332> them out before<WH6440> him; but he refused<WH3985> to eat.<WH398> And Amnon<WH550> said,<WH559> Have<WH3318> out all<WH3605> men<WH376> from me. And they went<WH3318> out every man<WH376> from him.

And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> to Tamar,<WH8559> Bring<WH935> the meat<WH1279> into the chamber,<WH2315> that I may eat<WH1262> of your hand.<WH3027> And Tamar<WH8559> took<WH3947> the cakes<WH3834> which<WH834> she had made,<WH6213> and brought<WH935> them into the chamber<WH2315> to Amnon<WH550> her brother.<WH251>
And when she had brought<WH5066> them to him to eat,<WH398> he took hold<WH2388> of her, and said<WH559> to her, Come<WH935> lie<WH7901> with me, my sister.<WH269>

And she answered<WH559> him, No,<WH408> my brother,<WH251> do<WH6213> not force<WH6031> me; for no<WH3808> such<WH3651> thing<WH3651> ought to be done<WH6213> in Israel:<WH3478> do not you this<WH2063> folly.<WH5039>

And I, where<WH575> shall I cause my shame<WH2781> to go?<WH3212> and as for you, you shall be as one<WH259> of the fools<WH5036> in Israel.<WH3478> Now<WH6258> therefore, I pray<WH4994> you, speak<WH1696> to the king;<WH4428> for he will not withhold<WH4513> me from you.
However, he would<WH14> not listen<WH8085> to her voice:<WH6963> but, being stronger<WH2388> than she, forced<WH6031> her, and lay<WH7901> with her.

Then Amnon<WH550> hated<WH8130> her exceedingly;<WH1419> <WH3966> so that the hatred<WH8135> with which<WH834> he hated<WH8130> her was greater<WH1419> than the love<WH160> with which<WH834> he had loved<WH157> her. And Amnon<WH550> said<WH559> to her, Arise,<WH6965> be gone.<WH3212>

And she said<WH559> to him, There is no<WH408> cause: this<WH2063> evil<WH7451> in sending<WH7971> me away is greater<WH1419> than the other<WH312> that you did<WH6213> to me. But he would<WH14> not listen<WH8085> to her.
Then he called<WH7121> his servant<WH5288> that ministered<WH8334> to him, and said,<WH559> Put<WH7971> now<WH4994> this<WH2063> woman out from me, and bolt<WH5274> the door<WH1817> after<WH310> her.

And she had a garment<WH3801> of divers<WH6446> colors<WH6446> on her: for with such<WH3651> robes<WH4598> were the king's<WH4428> daughters<WH1323> that were virgins<WH1330> appareled.<WH3847> Then his servant<WH8334> brought<WH3318> her out, and bolted<WH5274> the door<WH1817> after<WH310> her.

And Tamar<WH8559> put<WH3947> ashes<WH665> on<WH5921> her head,<WH7218> and rent<WH7167> her garment<WH3801> of divers<WH6446> colors<WH6446> that was on<WH5921> her, and laid<WH7760> her hand<WH3027> on<WH5921> her head,<WH7218> and went<WH3212> on crying.<WH2201>

And Absalom<WH53> her brother<WH251> said<WH559> to her, Has Amnon<WH550> your brother<WH251> been<WH1961> with you? but hold<WH2790> now<WH6258> your peace,<WH2790> my sister:<WH269> he is your brother;<WH251> regard<WH3820> not this<WH2063> thing.<WH1697> So Tamar<WH8559> remained<WH3427> desolate<WH8076> in her brother<WH251> Absalom's<WH53> house.<WH1004>
But when king<WH4428> David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of all<WH3605> these<WH428> things,<WH1697> he was very<WH3966> wroth.<WH2734>

And Absalom<WH53> spoke<WH1696> to his brother Amnon<WH550> neither<WH3808> good<WH2896> nor bad:<WH7451> for Absalom<WH53> hated<WH8130> Amnon,<WH550> because<WH5921> he had forced<WH6031> his sister<WH269> Tamar.<WH8559>

And it came<WH1961> to pass after two full<WH3117> years,<WH8141> that Absalom<WH53> had sheep shearers<WH1494> in Baalhazor,<WH1178> which<WH834> is beside<WH5973> Ephraim:<WH669> and Absalom<WH53> invited<WH7121> all<WH3605> the king's<WH4428> sons.<WH1121>

And Absalom<WH53> came<WH935> to the king,<WH4428> and said,<WH559> Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> your servant<WH5650> has sheep shearers;<WH1494> let the king,<WH4428> I beseech<WH4994> you, and his servants<WH5650> go<WH3212> with your servant.<WH5650>

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Absalom,<WH53> No,<WH408> my son,<WH1121> let us not all<WH3605> now<WH4994> go,<WH3212> lest<WH3808> we be chargeable<WH3513> to you. And he pressed<WH6555> him: however, he would<WH14> not go,<WH3212> but blessed<WH1288> him.

Then said<WH559> Absalom,<WH53> If<WH3808> not, I pray<WH4994> you, let my brother<WH251> Amnon<WH550> go<WH3212> with us. And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4100> should he go<WH3212> with you?
But Absalom<WH53> pressed<WH6555> him, that he let Amnon<WH550> and all<WH3605> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> go<WH7971> with him.

Now Absalom<WH53> had commanded<WH6680> his servants,<WH5288> saying,<WH559> Mark<WH7200> you now<WH4994> when Amnon's<WH550> heart<WH3820> is merry<WH2896> with wine,<WH3196> and when I say<WH559> to you, Smite<WH5221> Amnon;<WH550> then kill<WH4191> him, fear<WH3372> not: have not I commanded<WH6680> you? be courageous,<WH2388> and be valiant.<WH1121> <WH2428>

And the servants<WH5288> of Absalom<WH53> did<WH6213> to Amnon<WH550> as Absalom<WH53> had commanded.<WH6680> Then all<WH3605> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> arose,<WH6965> and every man<WH376> got<WH7392> him up on his mule,<WH6505> and fled.<WH5127>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, while they were in the way,<WH1870> that tidings<WH8052> came<WH935> to David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> Absalom<WH53> has slain<WH5221> all<WH3605> the king's<WH4428> sons,<WH1121> and there is not one<WH259> of them left.<WH3498>

Then the king<WH4428> arose,<WH6965> and tare<WH7167> his garments,<WH899> and lay<WH7901> on the earth;<WH776> and all<WH3605> his servants<WH5650> stood<WH5324> by with their clothes<WH899> rent.<WH7167>

And Jonadab,<WH3122> the son<WH1121> of Shimeah<WH8093> David's<WH1732> brother,<WH251> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> Let not my lord<WH113> suppose<WH559> that they have slain<WH4191> all<WH3605> the young<WH5288> men the king's<WH4428> sons;<WH1121> for Amnon<WH550> only<WH905> is dead:<WH4191> for by the appointment<WH6310> of Absalom<WH53> this has been<WH1961> determined<WH7760> from the day<WH3117> that he forced<WH6031> his sister<WH269> Tamar.<WH8559>

Now<WH6258> therefore let not my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> take<WH7760> the thing<WH1697> to his heart,<WH3820> to think<WH559> that all<WH3605> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> are dead:<WH4191> for Amnon<WH550> only<WH905> is dead.<WH4191>

But Absalom<WH53> fled.<WH1272> And the young<WH5288> man that kept the watch<WH6822> lifted<WH5375> up his eyes,<WH5869> and looked,<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> there came<WH1980> much<WH7227> people<WH5971> by the way<WH1870> of the hill<WH2022> side<WH6654> behind<WH310> him.
And Jonadab<WH3122> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> Behold,<WH2009> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> come:<WH935> as your servant<WH5650> said,<WH1697> so<WH3651> it is.

And it came<WH1961> to pass, as soon as he had made an end<WH3615> of speaking,<WH1696> that, behold,<WH2009> the king's<WH4428> sons<WH1121> came,<WH935> and lifted<WH5375> up their voice<WH6963> and wept:<WH1058> and the king<WH4428> also<WH1571> and all<WH3605> his servants<WH5650> wept<WH1058> very<WH3966> sore.<WH1419>

But Absalom<WH53> fled,<WH1272> and went<WH3212> to Talmai,<WH8526> the son<WH1121> of Ammihud,<WH5989> king<WH4428> of Geshur.<WH1650> And David mourned<WH56> for his son<WH1121> every<WH3605> day.<WH3117>
So Absalom<WH53> fled,<WH1272> and went<WH3212> to Geshur,<WH1650> and was there<WH8033> three<WH7969> years.<WH8141>
And the soul of king<WH4428> David<WH1732> longed<WH3615> to go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> to Absalom:<WH53> for he was comforted<WH5162> concerning<WH5921> Amnon,<WH550> seeing he was dead.<WH4191>
